content.description: The figure is not drawn to scale. The horizontal base of the elliptical region represents the longer axis of the ellipse. The base is labeled 120. A vertical segment from the center of the base to the top of the ellipse is labeled 20. A dashed vertical segment is shown to the right of the segment labeled 20. The dashed segment is labeled as perpendicular to the base. The distance from the vertical segment in the center to the dashed segment is labeled as 20. The dashed vertical segment intersects the top of the figure at a point labeled uppercase X.
content.question: The figure shows the arch of a bridge over a river. The arch is in the shape of half an ellipse. The horizontal axis of the ellipse is at water level and is <math alttext="120"><mn>120</mn></math> feet (ft) wide. The maximum distance from the water level to the arch is <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> ft. What is the height of the arch at point <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math>, which is directly above the water and <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> ft horizontally from the center of the ellipse?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
